Event.name: Traversing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Theme</fen> changes location with respect to a salient location, which can be expressed by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, <fen>Goal</fen>, <fen>Area</fen>, <fen>Direction</fen>, <fen>Path_shape</fen>, or <fen>Distance</fen>, as shown in the examples below: <ex></ex>
<ex>Start <fex name="Theme">your</fex> <t>ascent</t> <fex name="Source">from Achintree Farm in Glen Nevis</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">We</fex> <t>crossed</t> <fex name="Area">the desert</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">She</fex> <t>jumped</t> <fex name="Path">across the ditch that marked the entrance to the woods</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">The children</fex> <t>hopped</t> <fex name="Goal">into the neighbor's yard</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">I</fex> <t>leaped</t> <fex name="Distance">twenty feet</fex> before slipping and falling.</ex>
<ex>As they did so, <fex name="Theme">the plane</fex> <t>circled</t> <fex name="Direction">lower</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">Boyner</fex> has been <t><fex name="Path_shape">crisscrossing</fex></t> <fex name="Area">the country</fex> <fex name="dur">since May</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the object which moves. In many sentences this FE will be expressed as something which moves under its own power. However, this FE is not <ment>required</ment> to be an animate mover, so it is different from Self_mover. <ex><fex name="Theme">Kim</fex> <t>crossed</t> through the woods.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<ex>The cat <t>crossed</t> the street <fex name="Source">from her yard</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> (see below) expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, including directional expressions:
<ex>The bikers <t>crisscrossed</t> <fex name="Path">through the desert</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The cyclist <t>ascended</t> <fex name="Path">towards the gate</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal.
<ex>The children <t>hopped</t> <fex name="Goal">into the neighbor's yard</fex>.</ex>
Some particles imply the existence of a Goal which is understood in the context of utterance: <ex>The children <t>hopped</t> <fex name="Goal">over</fex> and sat down.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Manner</fen>. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions. <ex>The bikers <t>crossed</t> <fex name="Manner">furiously</fex> through the desert.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Distance</fen>. <ex>I <t>leaped</t> <fex name="Distance">twenty feet</fex> before slipping and falling.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. <ex>The bikers <t>crisscrossed</t> <fex name="Area">the desert</fex>.</ex> Note that this FE should not be used for any locational modifier which would occur just as naturally with a non-motion predicate, like speech.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>Degree to which event occurs</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event involving the <fen>Theme</fen> that results in the <fen>Theme</fen> moving in the specified way. <ex>The less experienced mountaneers <t>ascended</t> <fex name="Mns">by crawling</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which the <fen>Theme</fen> moves.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cotheme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique:
<ex>The squirrel <t>leaped</t> <fex name="Cotheme">after it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action
<ex>We <t>crisscrossed</t> the country <fex name="Depictive">naked</fex></ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path_shape
Arg.definition: <def-root>The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>, taken simultaneously. <ex>He <t>circled</t> downward <fex name="PS">in a spiral</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The direction in which the <fen>Theme</fen> goes.
<ex>The frogs <t>jumped</t> <fex name="dir">down</fex> through the meadow.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the motion takes place.
<ex>They <t>crisscrossed</t> the country <fex name="tim">in April</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Theme</fen> wishes to bring about.
<ex>The participants <t>circled</t> around <fex name="pur">in order to avoid the house.</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means_of_motion
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The device or bodypart that serves to move the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>We <t>crossed</t> the river <fex name="Means_of_motion">by boat</fex>.</ex> <ex>Bravo company broke an axle while trying to <t>jump</t> a ditch <fex name="Means_of_motion">in a Humvee</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Theme</fen> spends in motion.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Theme</fen> at the end of the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Reciprocation
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event paired with the motion, which explains why the motion is expected. In particular, or an action that <fen>Reciprocation</fen> is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished by the motion, is paired with the motion as the other side of an agreement.</def-root >

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time the Traversing occurs and which the Traversing is taken to be a part of.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The number of times that an action occurs in a given time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>A larger conceptualization that includes the Traversing as an integral part. The Traversing expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization. </def-root>

Arg.name: New_situation
Arg.definition: <def-root>An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the Theme), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the Traversing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Traversing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole.</def-root>

Arg.name: Endpoints
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen> of either a single or a repeated motion taken together as <fen>Endpoints</fen> of the <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex>A large plastic "football" wildly <t>passed</t> <fex name="Endpoints">between goal posts</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Coordinated_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>The label <fen>Coordinated_event</fen> is to be used for phrases denoting an event-it does not allow states-that the Traversing is rhythmically aligned with. The <fen>Coordinated_event</fen> is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the <fen>Coordinated_event</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time period within which the motion event occurs repeatedly. </def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: skirt.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move around the edge of a location

lexUnit.name: mount.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: climb up or on to; ascend.

lexUnit.name: descent.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of coming down (something).

lexUnit.name: cross.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: go to the other side of (a bridge or obstacle).

lexUnit.name: crisscross.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move or travel around (a place) by going back and forth repeatedly.

lexUnit.name: ascent.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of climbing up (an inclined entity).

lexUnit.name: pass.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go past or across; leave behind or on one side in proceeding.

lexUnit.name: circle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move in a circle around
